alert.note: Alert for Erie; Niagara (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 20 at 7:11PM EDT until July 20 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Erie County in western New York... Niagara County in western New York... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 710 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Youngstown to 11 miles northwest of Evangola State Park, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Youngstown, Lewiston, Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Lackawanna, Kenmore, and Depew. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 57A. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
